programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie fabricate a new engine stand for the shop.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie B. take us through the evolution of the iconic Chevy small block engine over the years, and show how it evolved into today’s LS series.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Willie and Kevin take us through the shop, showing us a ton of cool stuff and how it works.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: The guys take us through the Dana and Ford rear ends, showing which would be right for your application.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin takes us to a race shop where he sees what goes into a high performance NASCAR team.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: The guys bring new life to a Model A by getting the electric starter back into working order with a new ring gear.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The time has finally come. Brett Torino is coming and he is here for his car, the legendary 1 of 2 ever made, 1970 Coronet! Mark wouldn’t be Mark, though, without a few tricks up his sleeve. When Brett arrives to collect on his long restoration from the Mopar Master, the reveal of this truly one of a kind car is done with style. But not before Mark takes us back through the entire restoration leading up to that point. It Is the last 1970 Hemi Coronet Convertible on earth, after all.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The crew is overwhelmed with several restorations at once. From painting stripes, to engine parts, to missing parts on the 71 Charger, tensions are high around the shop. To Make things worse, Mark is obsessed with finding a factory pink Mopar for his granddaughter's 16th birthday.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.sub-title: It's the Great Pumpkin, Mark Worman!
programme.desc: The crew at Graveyard Carz are excited about the pumpkin carving contest, but when a mistake leaves the 'Cuda filled with water, the whole crew has to pay the price. Royal saves the day, but with the carving contest back on the table, where are the pumpkins? Mark has to swallow his pride and accept help from Daren for the contest to go ahead.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Daren is given control of the shop for a week. Darenʼs constant pestering and ribbing leads Mark to hand him the reigns of Graveyard Carz for a week. But instead of getting things done, Daren starts inventing new field trips and distractions for the crew, as well as becoming obsessed with getting his personal Dodge Challenger running again.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Mark receives an angry call from the owner of the 1970 Roadrunner, which leads to a mad rush to get the car finished in time. Meanwhile, Josh pushes the crew into committing to some New Years resolutions.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Frustrated by the crew's complaints that he spends all day being lazy in the front office. Mark is determined to prove to the guys that there is more to restoring a car than physical labor. Josh and Daren visit the crash site of the mangled orange 1971 'Cuda.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: As the team works to complete a multitude of cars, Mark stresses over the metal dipping of the very rare and valuable ʻ71 Cuda 440-6. Tensions are high and time is limited, is the GYC crew up to the pressure?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls get the remains back from the '71 440 Six Barrel, 4 Speed, Shaker Hood Phantom Cuda and determine if the car can be resurrected. A '69 Dodge Daytona Charger arrives ready to be brought back from the dead and Mark gets a 2011 SRT8 Dodge Challenger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls get the N96 Air Grabber installed on the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car. It's started and is ready for final assembly. The owners of '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car visit to check on the restoration progress.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Mark is hired to restore the body, paint, and suspension of a '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car. The shop gets some needed upgrades and the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car is completed to OEM Specifications.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The '70 Sunroof Challenger is painted and ready for final assembly. The '69 Daytona Charger is disassembled and readied to be shipped to the media blasters. Mark and the Ghoulz head out to the junkyard to blow off some steam playing paintball.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghoulz use their brand new Shop Crane to lower the body of the '71 Cuda 340 Triple Black 'Phantasm' Tribute car onto its restored suspension and its drive-train is assembled and installed.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The '69 Daytona Charger returns from the media blaster and Mark gives Josh a history lesson on the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel Car before removing it's drive-train and suspension.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls get the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car completely disassembled and off to the media blaster. Mark disassembles and restores the right-hand door to the 71' 440 Phantom Cuda. In addition, the headliner and vinyl top is installed in the 71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls get the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car completely disassembled and off to the media blaster. Mark disassembles and restores the right-hand door to the 71' 440 Phantom Cuda. In addition, the headliner and vinyl top is installed in the 71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The owner of the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car visits the shop and learns about assembly-line markings. Mark checks the paint on the body of the '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car and discovers a major problem.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls receives a '70 Barracuda Convertible to get a full restoration. Despite improbability, Mark straightens the fender for the '71 440 Phantom Cuda and the crew continues the restoration of the '71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls receives a '70 Barracuda Convertible to get a full restoration. Despite improbability, Mark straightens the fender for the '71 440 Phantom Cuda and the crew continues the restoration of the '71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The ghouls detail and assemble the suspension of the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car. The owners of the '70 Plymouth Superbird, in the queue for resurrection, visit the shop and Daren convinces the crew to throw a birthday party for Mark.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: Nick Rutter provides tips and techniques for restoring dull, faded paint using a forced-rotation dual action polisher along with a graphene 3-in-1 ceramic polish, along with severe scratch and scuff removal.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how super clean automotive upholstery, as well as the proper chemicals and detailing tools for deep cleaning vinyl and rubber surfaces.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: Time to get low with a K5 Blazer. Matt and Bruno are going to C-notch the frame and and this 73’ blazer while still using the factory wheels and tires.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: A Blazer with an LS engine is cool, but the interior is far from ready. Matt and Bruno totally transform the interior with seats and door panels and have an almost drivable Blazer when we’re done.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: This fleet F150 needs a kick into high gear. We’ll give the truck some needed stopping power with an upgraded brake kit and we’ll bolt on some power upgrades under the hood.
